page.title: 03Edingale The Village Cont.
page.content: The small church in the village is dedicated to the Holy Trinity. In 1975 the tower had to be rebuilt following damage by gales. The village school, which caters for the childrens educational needs from the age of four until they are eleven,is called the Mary Howard Primary after a former benefactress. The two general stores are important to the life of the villagers since it is several miles to the nearest town and some people do not own a car.The public service bus calls just four times a day.One of the shops also serves as a Post Office. The purpose built Village Hall has a playing field and childrens playground adjacent to it and in the same area there is the school playing field.
